brief_summary.textblock:
In this study, the investigators examine whether aspirin or warfarin is useful for atrial
      fibrillation patients with chronic kidney disease.

clinical_study.brief_title: Warfarin Versus Aspirin in Patients With Atrial Fibrillation and Chronic Kidney Disease

detailed_description.textblock:
randomised open labelled prospective study

      We enroll patients with CHADS2 score 1 non-valvular AF with chronic kidney disease, and
      analyze all thromboembolic event or major bleeding event during follow-up period. Warfarin
      group take dose adjusted warfarin (target INR 2.0-3.0) and aspirin group take aspirin 100mg
      daly.

      Thromboembolic events: Ischemic stroke or systemic arterial occlusion Major bleeding:
      gastrointestinal bleeding or intracranial bleeding (code 430, code 431, code 432 by ICD-9-CM
      codes)

      -> Only the first event of each case will be used for the analysis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  CHADS2 score 1 nonvalvular atrial fibrillation patients with chronic kidney disease

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  HAS-BLED ≥30

          -  History of syncope or seizure within 1 year

          -  History of major bleeding event within 6 months

          -  BP>180/100

          -  Abnormal prothrombin time

          -  Hypersensitivity of  aspirin or warfarin

          -  Folstein mini mental state examination score <26

          -  Taking or had taken other anticoagulants

clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Controlled Prospective Trial of Warfarin Versus Aspirin for Stroke Prevention in Patients With Atrial Fibrillation and Chronic Kidney Disease

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
